channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: There is a dip in the pathway, it is a trip hazard especially when you take into account the number of elderly residents in Shannon Way. The puddles in the photos give a good impression of the depth of the dip., 22nd January
item.description:
Uneven path/dip in pathway. This is a trip hazard, especially in the dark as the area is not particularly well light.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shannon Way, New Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress, household items, clothes dumped., 22nd January
item.description:
Fly tipping is a constant issue outside Block 1 Transom Close next to the bin cupboard. It happens on a regular basis.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Sea Street, Rotherhithe, Greater London

item.title: Street bin, 22nd January
item.description:
Yellow street bin opposite 13 is full please empty

item.title: Slowly expanding pothole opposite 4 Gresham Avenue, 22nd January
item.description:
There's a slowly expanding pothole opposite for Gresham Avenue. At the moment it's big enough to swallow a foot. Maybe before too long, it'll be big enough to swallow a person. Perhaps we could go for a swim in it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Gresham Avenue, Friern Barnet, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned blue bin full of rubbish, 22nd January
item.description:
I reported this in November ref 8438440 and it is still here. It’s full of various rubbish and just lucky it hasn’t been knocked over. Please take it away. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brenchley Gardens, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping at Newmarsh Road, SE28 8TA, 22nd January
item.description:
Flytipping outside 65 Newmarsh Road, SE28 8TA and in the underpass adjacent to 65 Newmarsh Road. Constantly recurring issue. It has been cleared in the past but soon reoccurs. Area needs constant monitoring.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Newmarsh Road, Thamesmead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sofas, rubbish, clothes, 22nd January
item.description:
This is a continued problem, this spot has become a fly tipping spot for cars to come and drop off any large items they don’t want like sofas, mattresses, chairs, desks, everything. CCTV cameras are needed in the area to identify who’s going it. It happens weekly
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Kent Road, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on wooden fence between two blocks, 22nd January
item.description:
This wooden fencing is deteriorating and needs replacing. It has graffiti on it and there are trees etc growing behind it. Please contact the freehold owner to address these problems. The location is Melbourne Grive in East Dulwich - close to Dudrich Mews (nearest block number on Melbourne Grove is 97)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 101, Melbourne Grove, East Dulwich, Greater London

item.title: Faded yellow lines, 22nd January
item.description:
Double yellow lines faded The double yellow lines on danson crescent and selwyn crescent have not been repainted. This is causing people to park on corners and over driveways while collecting there children. The rest of the high street and surrounding roads have be repainted but this have been left. The report's reference number is 8553434. Please quote this if you need to contact the council about this report.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Selwyn Crescent, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
